page.title: 15Hoffmann of Chelmsford
page.content: {R.H.P.}is one of the{biggest ball {and roller bearing}factories in {Britain.}It's work force was{once over {5000}but is{now}down to{1250.}The car industry is their main customer and they export to many countries. In world war 2 the factory was a prime target for German bombs and considerable damage was done and many workers were killed. At the turn of the century when they first began, Hoffmann had almost the whole sales market but after World War 2,other companies gave greater compet- ition.{In 1971 Ransome Hoffmann and {Pollard}combined and the future seemed more assured although in recent years cheaper bearings from Japan flooded the market and will continue to pose a threat to local employment.
